name: Land of Plenty
title: Most Arable Land Per Person
description: Kazakhstan boasts the highest arable land per person in the world, with 1.502 hectares available per individual as of 2021.

name: Slum-Free Cities
title: Lowest Urban Slum Population
description: In 2020, only 0.79% of Kazakhstan's urban population lived in slums, marking it as one of the countries with the least urban poverty.

name: Export Tax Titans
title: Highest Export Taxes
description: Kazakhstan imposed the highest taxes on exports in 2023, totaling 2,135,352,265,935.25 local currency units.

name: Education Champions
title: Perfect Primary Education Persistence
description: In 2019, 100% of male students in Kazakhstan persisted to the last grade of primary school, showcasing a strong educational foundation.

name: Higher Learning Nation
title: High Post-Secondary Educational Attainment
description: By 2018, 79.02% of Kazakhstan's population aged 25+ had completed post-secondary education, reflecting a well-educated populace.

name: Secondary School Stars
title: Near-Universal Secondary School Enrollment
description: Kazakhstan achieved a 99.84% net enrollment rate in secondary education by 2019, indicating widespread access to education.

name: Tertiary Triumph
title: High Short-Cycle Tertiary Completion
description: By 2018, 73.91% of Kazakhstan's population aged 25+ had completed short-cycle tertiary education, highlighting advanced educational achievements.

name: Clean Hands, Healthy Lives
title: Widespread Rural Handwashing Facilities
description: In 2019, 98.73% of Kazakhstan's rural population had access to basic handwashing facilities, promoting public health.

name: Low Poverty Levels
title: Minimal Population Below Median Income
description: As of 2021, only 3.1% of Kazakhstan's population lived below 50% of the median income, indicating low poverty levels.

name: Employment Equality
title: High Employment Rates for All
description: In 2022, Kazakhstan had a high employment rate with 94.5% of females and 95.7% of males aged 15+ employed, totaling a 95.1% employment rate.

name: Food Security Success
title: Low Severe Food Insecurity
description: In 2022, only 0.6% of Kazakhstan's population faced severe food insecurity, reflecting effective food security measures.
